title: espresso : no module or dotkit file is created
body:
Originally posted on the mailing list. Installing espresso everything seems to go fine:

```
$ spack install -j 4 espresso + mpi ^ openblas
==> Installing espresso
==> Installing netlib-scalapack
==> mpich is already installed in /home/culpo/github/spack/opt/spack/x86_E5v2_IntelIB/gcc-4.4.7/mpich-3.2-nrn7n3mmfanakidvf2wincyv3ufml5k6.
==> openblas is already installed in /home/culpo/github/spack/opt/spack/x86_E5v2_IntelIB/gcc-4.4.7/openblas-0.2.15-mpo65vvesylmxza7v5w5ahghvcbchnxd.
==> Already downloaded /home/culpo/github/spack/var/spack/stage/netlib-scalapack-2.0.2-rhdi75kxexltc7ejtes5oopne4uu7lpc/netlib-scalapack-2.0.2.tgz.
==> Already staged netlib-scalapack-2.0.2-rhdi75kxexltc7ejtes5oopne4uu7lpc in /home/culpo/github/spack/var/spack/stage/netlib-scalapack-2.0.2-rhdi75kxexltc7ejtes5oopne4uu7lpc.
==> No patches needed for netlib-scalapack.
==> Building netlib-scalapack.
==> Successfully installed netlib-scalapack.

==> mpich is already installed in /home/culpo/github/spack/opt/spack/x86_E5v2_IntelIB/gcc-4.4.7/mpich-3.2-nrn7n3mmfanakidvf2wincyv3ufml5k6.
==> Installing fftw
==> mpich is already installed in /home/culpo/github/spack/opt/spack/x86_E5v2_IntelIB/gcc-4.4.7/mpich-3.2-nrn7n3mmfanakidvf2wincyv3ufml5k6.
==> Trying to fetch from file:///ssoft/E5v3/downloads/fftw/fftw-3.3.4.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /ssoft/E5v3/downloads/fftw/fftw-3.3.4.tar.gz

==> No patches needed for fftw.
==> Building fftw.

  Fetch: 0.09s.  Build: 1m 44.79s.  Total: 1m 44.88s.
[+] /home/culpo/github/spack/opt/spack/x86_E5v2_IntelIB/gcc-4.4.7/fftw-3.3.4-bljkqbojgol5dequk3b6kbcyhzyeskkm
==> openblas is already installed in /home/culpo/github/spack/opt/spack/x86_E5v2_IntelIB/gcc-4.4.7/openblas-0.2.15-mpo65vvesylmxza7v5w5ahghvcbchnxd.
```

except that no module or dotkit file gets created:

```
$ ls share/spack/{dotkit,modules}/x86_E5v2_IntelIB/ | grep "^e"
elpa-2015.11.001-gcc-4.9.3-2b3uaudbffhggtjde6mbvim54cl7shkv.dk
elpa-2015.11.001-gcc-4.9.3-2b3uaudbffhggtjde6mbvim54cl7shkv
```
